title: ADC's should be addressed before Towers.
body:
Im not saying Towers arent weak, but Hypercarry adc's are stomping on everyone in 20-30 minute games. If towers get buffed now, we're going to have 45 minute games with Twitch and Vayne mains in every game.

So Riot, Turrets DO need a buff but not before something is done by adc hypercarries.

replies.body:
The thing that just frustrates me about ADCs is that they're never irrelevant. Unlike every other role where if they go 0/10 they have to open mid, ADCs never have this issue. All ADCs have to do to get back into the game is to literally pick up 1-2 core damage items and suddenly they can out DPS the extremely fed assassin/duelist/bruiser who has been popping off the whole game and has 2-3 items up on them. Sure, that's exaggeration, but it's true.

Case and point, I annihilated my mid laner as Kat and I made Tristana go 1/9. As my luck would have it, just because we couldn't end in the next 7 minutes Tristana miraculously got her Shiv->IE+a Zeal off to the side and suddenly she got to be 12/9 in the next 5 minutes. Sure, her team certainly helped her, but the numbers she was dealing in terms of damage was absolutely obnoxious. 

Want another example or a few just to be safe. Twitch, Xayah, Varus, Kog'maw, Vayne. All of those champions SHOULD be bloody late game hyper carries, but that couldn't be further from the truth since the moment they pick up their first 1-2 core damage items they just turn into these walking artilleries with either an excess of flank-ability or an excess amount of utility (CC) for the team. 

Personally I just think that Precision is still far too broken on ADCs and the decision to make it primarily for ADCs was a stupid choice in terms of gameplay design. But they can't nerf it too hard otherwise it impacts the classes who actually have no other proper tree to function with, so bruisers. Like....why does the ADC class get this tree almost exclusively for them and yet every other class' tree is so "eh" compared to theirs (in terms of functionality at least, different story balance wise)?

It also doesn't help that Riot has made the game legitimately ONLY about bot lane, specifically catering to the AD carry. Seriously, we used to have to rely on other lanes to win, now you legit just forcefully win bot lane if they're not winning already and wow....you suddenly win the game. Literally the macro to win the fucking game in higher elos is you just spoonfeed your bot lane until your ADC auto carries you through objectives, teamfights and sieges.
How that is healthy to Riot we will never know.

But yeah, you can never fully lockout an ADC from turning the game around. It's pretty disgusting.
(Unless you match an ADC against an ADC)

Also yeah that png just makes me suffer whenever I look at each role tag that says "ADC".

EU and LCK clearly understand. NA though ~_~ always behind. 

There is one player, on every team in every game, whose designation it is to basically not play the game. CSing is part of the game, but holy crap they have all this talk about wanting interactivity and how trading is exciting, yet the design of the professional scene **(and therefore the game in general)** has defaulted the ADC to be a literal potato that the support carries around in their pocket for 30 minutes. 

The crux of the problem is that since other champions rely on abilities to deal damage, and since bot lane levels slower than the rest of the players on the map, any mage in the bot lane is inherently in a weakened state by being there. People would love to try comps with Karthus or Ziggs bot (that one we've seen) but the limiting factor is the Lvl 2 power spike being prohibitive to some champions because the lvl 2 lasts so much longer in that lane. Combined with farming being difficult with low AD numbers and being pigeon holed into building mana instead of actual stats, it's just an up hill battle. There's no reason to do it, so nobody does. It creates the "meta" we see now - every team comp is one potato and the four horseman of the apocalypse, except the potato is the dangerous one.

What Riot should do is narrow that spectrum of variability, by giving them more tools to use themselves but hitting their reliability of damage output. This is their current design philosophy with other champs, so the class just needs modernization.

Simple nerfs aren't going to do it, since their design is essentially the same and will come back sooner or later just as strong. Something of what I propose, for example, is modifying crit as a stat to have only some of its power invested in autoattacks.

But those are just some quick thoughts.
Pretty sure ADC is made of up two subclasses that have swapped into being relevant and not relevant. We've had a Lucian, Sivir, Ezreal caster meta, and then we had a Tristana Twitch hypercarry meta.

Same for Yi, Yasuo, same for literally any ADC.  The only only one who even compares to this that doesnt use crit is Katarina, who can go 0/10 and then get 2 kills and snowball the game back into her favor.
